name: Sony DualShock 4
variants: Revised model (2016) with improved battery life and light bar visibility
colorOptions: Jet Black, Glacier White, Magma Red, Wave Blue, Urban Camouflage
Various limited editions and special colors
stickFeatures: Improved analog sticks with better grip
touchpadDetails: Multi-touch capacitive touchpad with click functionality
lightFeatures: LED light bar for player identification and game feedback
regionDifferences: Button symbols vary by region (X and O functions swapped in Japan)
supportOnPC: Full support via Steam, partial support in other applications
notableGames: The Last of Us Part II
designNotes: The DualShock 4 introduced several revolutionary features including a touchpad, light bar, and built-in speaker. The design focused on improved ergonomics and new ways to interact with games.
history: Development began in 2010 alongside the PlayStation 4. Sony conducted extensive user testing to refine the controller's ergonomics and feature set.
reception: Widely praised for its improved ergonomics, innovative touchpad, and overall build quality. The light bar and speaker were initially controversial but became appreciated features.
legacy: Set new standards for controller innovation with its touchpad and light bar. Influenced the design of future controllers across the industry.
technicalChallenges: Light bar could be distracting in dark rooms
Touchpad durability issues in early models
descriptionShort: Revolutionary PlayStation 4 controller with touchpad, light bar, and motion controls.
descriptionLong: The DualShock 4 is Sony's fourth iteration of the DualShock controller series, designed for the PlayStation 4. It features a revolutionary touchpad, LED light bar, built-in speaker, and improved ergonomics over its predecessor.
